reviews.review:
When I first played this game hacking was so common (killers teleporting on top of you/survivors instant healing multiple times after being hooked, releasing themselves off of hooks in one go multiple times instead of dying to the entity after the second hook- which still happens) so I stopped playing because my giggles turned to annoyance and I uninstalled.  Since starting again I can say that it's improved a little- the graphics are still 6/10 but I guess for compatibility. The only other complaint I have is that DBD has in a sense just become another game with a battle pass - Can't tell you how many games I've dropped because of a BP- so DBD will probably be another one that I leave pretty soon after I get my fill of it.
 You have to buy survivors and killers which is fine, I hope they add The Creeper from Jeepers Creepers or a werewolf/vampire/classic monsters or the Until Dawn characters + Wendigo.
 I wish outfits were unlocked through prestige or rewarded somehow after a certain quota is met with no battle pass, but also instant buy for the people who want it right then. I don't like how they included Heather Mason from SH3 and Pyramid Head from SH2, it doesn't follow the lore from the original 4 games. (the movies suck and don't count). Claudia/The Missionary boss or the "demon" Cheryl should have been added instead. Or James Sunderland from SH2 instead of Heather. 
Pros- 
-Game is fun and legit can be scary and also very funny. 
-Killers are cool looking, looking forward to more killers in the future hopefully.
-cool music and individual sound effects when killers are near
-The maps aren't too complicated but feel very dated
-outfits are mix and match if you don't want the full thing you can get individual pieces.. that being said...
-

sidenote: I wish there was more story involved

Cons- 
-Hacking still a problem, there is a difference between a high level character with good perks vs a hacker who instant heals after every strike. (happened to me earlier as I was playing the plague killer- I would place a survivor on a hook and they'd get down in one shot and then be instant healed with no injuries really quickly)
0The graphics aren't that great
-the best outfits can only be purchased with real money and not obtained through loot or playing the game. 
 rift fragments are another type of currency that don't guarantee the outfit you want either but are easily obtained. 
-There's a battle pass which gives rewards if bought and the free version, which is pretty pitiful as it gives almost nothing and I'm not exaggerating.
sort of? player rank if you care about that, but ultimately its just thrown at you for doing stuff in a match you dont even have to be good. 20=  new players or players who don't play often, 1= the better players. it counts down.
Great game! Mostly good community too! But don't expect anything if the game glitches and you magically end up with a purchase that you didn't want. Thanks EULA!

top top vale muito apena mas, ai so falta jason

Listen, Imma be honest, this game from a technical standpoint is dog shit, there are so many bugs and quality of life things that must be changed. For christ sake the party system doesn't even work half the time, but man oh man is this game fun as hell to play with friends. Playing with non-meta perks and just dicking around against the killer is so unbelievably fun to do. There are things to be frustrated at the devs for, but making a genuinely fun experience with friends isn't one of them.

I have to recommend this game, it's usually on sale, you don't have to really pay money to get skins, and you can grind for DLC pretty easily. And my god is it fun as hell with friends.
Very fun and scary when the killer is fuckin' chasing you and you shit your pants
Love the game, spent many hours playing and still have not got bored of the game

What can I say I have been playing this game since Beta, that's right ignore all review this is the one to look at (just a joke btw except the beta part ). I do recomend this game just be wary as a new player the tutorial as is stands as the day I right this is not garbage but misses a lot that is esential to the game. The tutorial covers 10 things when the game has 1,000  to learn my advice play with friends, watch True talent/ Otz they are both good. Look up DBD tier list  https://dennisreep.nl/dbd/ it's what I used and guides on how to loop and deal with each killer, join the dbd discord and maybe try to find someone teach you about each killer / perks, etc.  You are going to have a good time, some games will be rough, but over all it has been a great experience be prepared also the community is also kinda toxic.
addicting game beside hitboxes being the sizes of planets and balance making 0 sense. 11/10

There needs to be some kind of off-line practice mode so you can get the hang of the game. In it's current state you are just kinda thrown into the mix with other, vastly more experienced players and it's not fun at all. After a few more hours, it still needs a kind of practice mode.
